key_insight: An exploratory RCT with N=165 UK secondary students shows that a pedagogy‑tuned generative model (LearnLM) integrated into chat‑based math tutoring can safely support and improve classroom learning, offering scalable one‑to‑one assistance.
problem_solved: Addresses the gap between high‑effectiveness one‑to‑one tutoring and its prohibitive cost/scale by testing whether generative AI can deliver safe, effective personalized support in real classrooms.
method: Exploratory randomized controlled trial (N = 165) across five UK secondary schools evaluating AI‑assisted tutoring on the Eedi mathematics platform.
Integrated LearnLM (a generative model fine‑tuned for pedagogy) into chat‑based tutoring sessions with teacher oversight and safety monitoring.
Measured learning outcomes, engagement, and safety/quality of feedback versus control conditions using pre/post assessments and classroom observations.
impact: Provides real‑world RCT evidence that pedagogically tuned generative models can expand access to effective one‑to‑one tutoring while maintaining safety—important validation for ML practitioners building education models and deployment pipelines.
visual_elements: RCT flow diagram: participant enrollment, randomization, AI vs control arms, assessment timeline
Bar/line chart comparing pre/post learning gains for AI‑tutored vs control groups
Session schematic showing LearnLM in chat loop (student prompt → model feedback → teacher oversight)
Safety/quality dashboard mockup (error rates, flagged responses, teacher interventions)
paper_title: AI tutoring can safely and effectively support students: An exploratory RCT in UK classrooms
paper_authors: LearnLM Team, Eedi, :, Albert Wang, Aliya Rysbek
